t: List of Amazon brands - Wikipedia
s: November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: VFAUOSIT Brand Kitchen Faucets Recalled Due to Dangerous Lead Exposure for Young Children; Sold on Amazon.com by Whisper08 | CPSC.gov
s: Consumers should immediately stop using these faucets and contact Whisper08 about disposal and a refund. t: How do Stores work with other Amazon Ads products?
Why Amazon Is Terminating the 1P Model: A Guide for Brands
s: September 27, 2024 - Under the 1P model, Amazon took on the role of a traditional retailer, purchasing goods from vendors and reselling them, which involved substantial logistics and inventory management costs. Now, the company is encouraging brands to switch to the Third-Party (3P) model, managed via Seller Central, ...

t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 5 hours ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: Understanding the 3P Distribution Model on Amazon: Is It Right for Your Brand?
s: Brands selling on Amazon typically have three choices: 1P (selling directly to Amazon), 3P (selling as a third-party via Seller Central), or hybrid. Each comes with its own level of control, complexity, and risk. But for many modern brands, the 3P Full Distribution model offers a compelling ...

t: Brand management: Guide to growing your brand on Amazon
s: March 26, 2025 - Sponsored Display ads allow you to reach customers in and beyond the Amazon store and feature products from your brand’s catalog. All three ad types run using a cost-per-click (CPC) model, meaning you only pay when a customer clicks.

t: Amazon Puts Its Own “Brands” First Above Better-Rated Products – The Markup
s: We found that knowing only whether a product was an Amazon brand or exclusive could predict in seven out of every 10 cases whether Amazon would place it first in search results. These listings are not visibly marked as “sponsored” and they are part of a grid that Amazon identifies as “search results” in the site’s source code. (We only analyzed products in that grid, ignoring modules that are strictly for advertising.) ... A bar chart showing the accuracy of different models ...
